availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Doty (Barren County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Ann Mariah Perkins Doty. Father of John P. Doty, Theodore F. Doty, and Mariah "Belle" Doty. Farmer in Barren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Barren County in 1860. Owned six enslaved persons in Barren County in 1860. Farmer in Barren County in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, Division 1, p. 337A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, p. 916.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 2, p. 60B-61A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 433B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Barren County, KY, February 1864, p. 41.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #9217.
"Capt James Monroe Doty (1822-1897)," Find A Grave, Memorial #146637290, accessed January 14, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/146637290.
